intro: Galium graecum subsp. pseudocanum, commonly known as the Greek bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Galium graecum subsp. pseudocanum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky crevices.
